definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
breath/news/interest (on an investment or loan)/to cease/to stop/to rest/Taiwan pr. [xi2]
to have only a breath of life (idiom)

sentences.english: After leaving the smell of land behind him, he set his lines.
sentences.chinese: 在把陸地的氣息拋在身後之後，他放下了釣絲。

sentences.english: Soon the house smelled fresh and piney , and the day took on a festive air.
sentences.chinese: 很快，家裏聞起來很清新，帶着節日的氣息。

sentences.english: Can you feel the spring in the air?
sentences.chinese: 你有沒有感受到春天的氣息？

sentences.english: They also will make your feet smell like lavender.
sentences.chinese: 並且會讓腳丫有薰衣草的氣息。

sentences.english: With the petals in your mouth, spring atmosphere pervades mouthful.
sentences.chinese: 將花瓣含在嘴裏，讓滿嘴都是春的氣息。

sentences.english: Burnt-orange paint injects warmth into this country home's foyer and stairwell.
sentences.chinese: 土黃色給這個鄉村風格的空間帶來溫暖的氣息。

sentences.english: Than in the breath that from my mistress reeks.
sentences.chinese: 比出自我情人口中的氣息。

sentences.english: As Frost's Descent comes, the world is filled with the atmosphere of late autumn.
sentences.chinese: 伴隨着霜降的到臨，萬物充滿了晚秋的氣息。

sentences.english: Our sterling silver strawberry charm captures the essence of this quintessentially summer fruit.
sentences.chinese: 我們由純銀製成的草莓吊飾，散發着夏曰果子的氣息。

sentences.english: I seemed to feel a breath of spring in the air.
sentences.chinese: 我似乎感覺到了空氣中春天的氣息。

sentences.english: Musk is a kind of strong-smelling substance.
sentences.chinese: 麝香是一種有激烈氣息的物質。

sentences.english: In short, the culture-related recreational consumption is gradually gaining currency.
sentences.chinese: 市民娛樂消費的文化氣息正在不斷增強。

sentences.english: The whole image-building shall give out such feeling.
sentences.chinese: 整個的形象塑造都將這種氣息散發出來。

sentences.english: A party and the talcum smell of sex.
sentences.chinese: 晚會和爽滑的異性氣息。

sentences.english: But the feeling aroused by the scenery cannot be described even by the poet.
sentences.chinese: 連詩人都無法形容的卻是那山水間勾人心魂的氣息。

definition: implicit charm in rhyme or sound/hinted appeal/interest
to pervade/to fill the air/diffuse/everywhere present/about to inundate (water)/permeated by (smoke)/filled with (dust)/to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
dense/thick (fog, clouds etc)/to have a strong interest in/deep/fully saturated (color)
to own exclusively/unique to/specific/there is only
